biogHist.abstract: Withnell House Child Home Closed is a lever-arch file that contains information relating to the Salvation Army's Withnell House in Mt Lawley and photographs of boys, staff and facilities there. The file also has information relevant to Hollywood Children's Village in Nedlands.
biogHist.p: Access to most items in the series is open, but it is essential to make an appointment to view.

This item contains a document, 'Withnell House, description 1980s', which is an undated letter that describes the programs and staffing at Withnell House before the residents moved to Oasis House (Mirrabooka) in 1987.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Withnell House Child Home Closed', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Withnell House child home closed file
archref.abstract: 'Withnell House History Book, cover' is a digital copy of an undated photcopy that is held in the Withnell House child home closed lever-arch file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. There is no personal information in the photocopy, but the item has a page of instructions that show what the History Book should record (p.3). It is possible that History Books were used in all Salvation Army institutions in Western Australia. The location of the original History Book is unknown.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Salvation Army Youth Hostel, Withnell House

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Withnell House child home closed file
archref.unittitle: The Salvation Army Youth Hostel, Withnell House
archref.abstract: 'The Salvation Army Youth Hostel, Withnell House' is a digital copy of a photograph that is held in the Withnell House child home closed lever-arch file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The photograph is undated, but the height of the palm near the sign suggests it may have been taken after the youth hostel opened in 1952 but before later pictures dated to the 1970s.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Withnell House child home closed file
archref.abstract:
'Withnell House, 1970s' is a digital copy of a photograph that is held in the Withnell House child home closed lever-arch file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The Salvation Army Heritage Museum's caption reads, 'The sign reads...The Salvation Army Youth Hostel - 1970's Withnell House Guildford Road, Mount Lawley WA'.
However, it is likely that this photograph has been incorrectly dated - during the 1970s, this property at Buildford Road, Mount Lawley was not a youth hostel. It is more likely to date from the 1980s.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Withnell House child home closed file
archref.abstract: 'Withnell House' is a digital copy of a history paper, prepared by The Salvation Army Historical Society, that is held in the Withnell House child home closed [File, Salvation Army] file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA.
